intro: Lunathyrium coreanum, commonly known as the Korean moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom at night, giving it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a subtle, aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
